title: For all of you who have been permabanned, just make a new account already.

embed.description: Hello everyone, this isn't your typical kind of guide here. This is not a champion specific guide, but you will find this information here very useful if you are trying to level up a new account. Please skip the runes, masteries, abilities, items, and the matchups sections.

body:
Some of you might say " I quit this game!" but the chances are that quitting will not make you happy. The fact that you were frustrated enough about your  ban to make a post and complain about it here shows that you will most likely miss this game if you quit.

The truth is that you actually still wan't to play this game.

I wrote a guide about leveling up your account very fast. It should only take you about 5-minutes to read this guide.  If you follow my advice in the guide, you should have your account up to level 30 within a week. Then you can do your ranked placements again.
http://www.lolking.net/guides/392167/preview

Everything described in the guide is okay, and won't get you banned. Buying a new account will get you banned. 

Also, playing without runes isn't as bad you think. The most important thing you still have is your game knowledge, experience and skill. Riot can take all your runes, champions, and skins but they can't take away your game knowledge.

**Edit: Original Link Broke. Use this link instead:**
http://www.lolking.net/guides/392167/preview

Grinding back all your champs and runes IS the issue banned players tend to have, and getting to 30 quicker doesn't change that at all. Content takes a completely asinine amount of time to earn in this game. It was set up with the intention that either players would only do it one time, or else spend money on everything so all their IP could go to runes.

You're also advocating AFKing, which has issues in and of itself, even if the game doesn't see it as such and it's in bot games.

_(For me specifically, I can live without the skins. In fact, I'd even re-buy most of mine if it meant I wouldn't have to spend months grinding for runes again. The cheap 'base' runes basically only give you a bruiser page and a half-baked AP page.)_

Well from my experience, getting perma-banned isnt as emotionally bad as it seems.  You subjectivly say its all about content. I use to think that too because I had a skin on almost all of my frequently played champs. However, I realized that I didn't even care about that stuff after the ban. I'm hoping other would realize this too.  People should shift their focus away from showing off (showing off your rare skins, mastery level, or champs) and focus more on just gameplay itself.

> [{quoted}](name=MaIevoIent,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=2oXvW00O,comment-id=0000000000010000,timestamp=2016-05-06T23:53:47.140+0000)
>
> People should shift their focus away from showing off (showing off your rare skins, mastery level, or champs) and focus more on just gameplay itself.

It's not about showing off, it's about being able to pick the champs you want to play and playing them. The objective of the game, first and foremost, is to have fun. 

For me, fun is being able to pick a champ I feel like using and playing them.  Now that I've been banned _(and I'm not going to say that wasn't my fault, because it was)_, the only way I can have this same fun again is if I either spend the better part of two years grinding IP or dump a ton of money on RP just to buy champions with.

It doesn't help either that matchmaking pre-30 is shaky due to the density of smurfs, and that I'm on the wrong end of it WAY more times than should be fair...
